questions.answer: The Lasso tool makes free-form selections. The Polygonal Lasso tool makes a selection with a series of connected line segments.

options: You can draw a free-form selection with the Lasso tool, but you must make Bezier curves with the Polygonal Lasso tool.

You can draw a free-form selection with the Lasso tool. You click and drag with the Polygonal Lasso tool to create Rectangular Marquee selections.
The Lass tool can select anything, including enclosed portions of raster images or shapes, but the Polygonal Lasso tool can select only shapes.

questions.question: What is the outcome if you make a selection and then add an adjustment layer?
questions.answer: The adjustment layer contains a layer mask that applies the adjustment only to the selected pixels.
questions.explanation: [Reference under the section titled 'Create and confine adjustment and fill layers'](https://helpx.adobe.com/photoshop/using/adjustment-fill-layers.html)
correctAnswer: The adjustment layer contains a layer mask that applies the adjustment only to the selected pixels.
options: The adjustment layer contains a vector mask that applies the adjustment only to the unselected pixels.
The adjustment layer contains a layer mask that applies the adjustment only to the selected pixels.
The adjustment layer contains a layer mask that applies the adjustment only to the unselected pixels.
The adjustment layer contains a vector mask that applies the adjustment only to the selected pixels.
